trans-unit.source: Provides an abstract class for controls that allow multiple items to be selected.

When you derive a class from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector> class, set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.CanSelectMultipleItems%2A> property to `true` to allow multi-selection in your control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector"></xref> class.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector> is an abstract class and cannot be instantiated directly.
Starts a new selection transaction.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.BeginUpdateSelectedItems%2A> method sets <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.IsUpdatingSelectedItems%2A> to `true`.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.EndUpdateSelectedItems%2A> method sets <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.IsUpdatingSelectedItems%2A> to `false`.
<xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.IsUpdatingSelectedItems"></xref> is `true` when this method is called.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the multiple items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector"></xref> can be selected at a time.
Set the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.CanSelectMultipleItems%2A> property to `true` in a derived class to allow multi-selection for that class.
`true` if multiple items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector"></xref> can be selected at a time; otherwise, `false`.
Commits the selected items to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector"></xref>.

This method sets <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.IsUpdatingSelectedItems%2A> to `false` and updates the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.SelectedItems%2A> collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.BeginUpdateSelectedItems%2A> method sets <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.IsUpdatingSelectedItems%2A> to `true`.
<xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.IsUpdatingSelectedItems"></xref> is `false` when this method is called.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector"></xref> is currently performing a bulk update to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.SelectedItems"></xref> collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.BeginUpdateSelectedItems%2A> method sets <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.IsUpdatingSelectedItems%2A> to `true`.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.EndUpdateSelectedItems%2A> method sets <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.IsUpdatingSelectedItems%2A> to `false`.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector"></xref> is currently performing a bulk update to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.SelectedItems"></xref> collection; otherwise, `false`.
Selects all of the items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector"></xref>.
You can use this method only if <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.CanSelectMultipleItems%2A> is `true`.
<xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.CanSelectMultipleItems"></xref> is `false`.
Gets the items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector"></xref> that are selected.

If <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.CanSelectMultipleItems%2A> is `false`, you cannot add more than one item to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.SelectedItems%2A> collection.
Attempts to do so will cause an exception.
The items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector"></xref> that are selected.
Unselects all of the items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector"></xref>.
You can use this method regardless of whether <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.MultiSelector.CanSelectMultipleItems%2A> is `true` or `false`.
